result.name: child-maintenance
result.notes: Child maintenance is financial support that helps towards a child’s everyday living costs when the parents have separated. The parent who doesn’t have day-to-day care of the child (the ‘paying parent’) pays child maintenance to the parent or person who does (the ‘receiving parent’).  The databases contain personal and financial information about paying parent; assessment of the maintenance required; personal details of the receiving parent and children and their locations. Data is produced on a daily basis.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Child Maintenance

extras.value: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions/series/child-maintenance-service-guidance    Not due to be released. Contains personal and sensitive data. Will be reviewed in the light of demand and prioritisation.
